description: Gives message MEncoder interrupted by user I did not interrupt anything. Total waste of time.

I wanted to rip a DVD I had recorded myself from a VHS camera, and Windows is notoriously unwilling to do any such thing, so I tried this utility.
The first review showing is very negative, and I can understand what they are saying, but the algorithm is actually very good, just hidden behind a poor interface.
First of all, I had to find where the DVD was, then type that into the window 'Video source path'. Clicking on 'Start' didn't seem to do anything, the encoding status does not update. I noticed however that the DVD was reading, then after searching in a file explorer, the size of the output file was increasing. 
So I started again, and this time the process finished almost immediately, without producing anything. Somewhere in the log was a message about failing to overwrite an existing file. With a new output file, things started again, with huge amounts of unhelpful error log messages. Examining the output file during writing showed a strange aspect ratio with unsynchronised audio.
However, I let it finish, and lo and behold, the utility had closed the file, corrected the aspect ratio, synchronised the audio, and even truncated off blank tape noise at the end of the recording.
If the author could find the time to bolt on an interface, this would be a winner.
sudo apt install libdvd-pkg && sudo dpkg-reconfigure libdvd-pkg
summary: Works Great once you install the needed codec

description: I tried using it but it only ripped 45 mins of the file

description: Flexible and easy to use, needs extra codecs to read the DVD.

I'm not sure if it's my distro or just my computer, but whatever it is, it doesn't work for me. I use ZorinOS on my i686 laptop. I tried to rip a DVD, but as soon as I start, it says "MEncoder interrupted by user." I looked around online and tried to find a fix and messed around with the settings the best I could, but to no avail.
summary: Doesn't seem to work for me

description: As Handbrake seems not to be working in ubuntu 20.04, tried this one but - it won't get rid of sub-titles. Backing up a dvd of ones private collection, sub titles are just annoying. So make sure to click on "sub file" which by my limited understanding of things computer, puts the sub file into a seperate file. In any case it seems to be how to rid oneself of the sub titles. Score? 9/10. Would have been 10/10 if it were not for the sub-titles.
I'll just switch back to Windows. No useful apps in Linux.
No idea how to get it to do something.

Got the suggested codecs, and installed the program.

It worked ONCE, then never again.

Goal:
Get video files from DVDs for educational videos

Software results:
Took me a few tries to understand how to use AcidRip DVD Ripper, but when I got working I had a couple of major issues:

1) Resolution is wrong - I clicked on Detect in the Video tab and it chooses the correct resolution, but the end result is squeezed (Scale is turned off). 

2) Subtitles - On the General tab I have Subtitles set to NONE but I still get Spanish subtitles.
summary: Didn't get what I expected based on settings
